titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mrs. Edward S. Harkness Collection of Lady Hamilton
Hamilton (Lady), Mrs. Edwards S. Harkness Collection of
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:02

did.unittitle: Mrs. Edward S. Harkness collection of Lady Hamilton

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.physdesc: (12 boxes) + 1 broadside folder, 1 art storage item
did.abstract: 9 bound volumes of music manuscripts mainly by Italian composers; letters written by Lady Hamilton, Horatio Nelson, and Sarah Nelson; 10 reproductions of paintings and engravings of Lady Hamilton; 9 bound volumes of printed music; and Lady Hamilton's music cabinet.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Edward S. Harkness, 1931.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Mrs. Edward S. Harkness Collection of Lady Hamilton is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mrs. Edward S. Harkness Collection of Lady Hamilton. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains various items relating to Lady Emma Hamilton, mistress of the British naval hero Admiral Horatio Nelson. Included are a number of bound volumes of printed and manuscript music, several letters among Lady Hamilton's family members, and reproductions of portraits of Lady Hamilton.
